sources.title: Journey's End
sources.description: Title: Journey's End Summary: In France, 1917, an alcoholic captain is afraid that his new replacement, his sweetheart's brother, will betray his downfall. Directed by: James Whale Actors: Colin Clive, Ian Maclaren, David Manners Production Company: Gainsborough Pictures Release Date: 9 April 1930 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.20 : 1 In France, 1917, an alcoholic captain is afraid that his new replacement, his sweetheart's brother, will betray his downfall.

sources.title: Journey's End (1930) COLIN CLIVE
sources.description:
Stars: Colin Clive, Ian Maclaren, David Manners
Director: James Whale

MOVIE CLASS: a year after this was produced, director James Whale made Cinematic history with his landmark film staring Colin Clive as Dr. Frankenstein.

Journey's End is a powerful anti-war drama set on the eve of battle, in the trenches of the western front during WWI. A British troop commander no longer believes in the cause for which he fights and is despondent over the thought he is sending young men to a pointless death.

metadata.Plot: In France, 1917, an alcoholic captain is afraid that his new replacement, his sweetheart's brother, will betray his downfall.
metadata.Writer: Gareth Gundrey, Joseph Moncure March, R.C. Sherriff
metadata.Actors: Colin Clive, Ian Maclaren, David Manners
